thread.title: New Hyatt Place hotel coming to Melbourne’s Essendon Airport
thread.title_full: New Hyatt Place hotel coming to Melbourne’s Essendon Airport - Australian Business Traveller

author: Chris Chamberlin
title: New Hyatt Place hotel coming to Melbourne’s Essendon Airport
text:
Melbourne’s Essendon Airport precinct will gain an on-site hotel with the opening of a Hyatt Place property in early 2017.
Offering a more contemporary take on the traditional Hyatt brand and as the first Hyatt Place hotel in Australia, the Melbourne property will boast 166 rooms and an adjacent events centre with space for up to 1,000 guests spanning 1,700m 2 .
That’s also being joined by a 24/7 fitness centre, complimentary wireless Internet for all guests, a restaurant and bar by Peter Rowland and an all-night dining menu.
Situated in Melbourne’s northwest, the Hyatt Place Essendon Airport hotel is roughly 6.5km from the city’s main Tullamarine Airport, and around 10km from the city centre.
Members of the Hyatt Gold Passport scheme will be able to both earn and redeem points at the Hyatt Place, while Platinum and Diamond cardholders will earn even more points per dollar spent, enjoy faster Internet access and may be able to secure a room when the hotel is fully-booked.
Also read: Hyatt Place Chicago: Downtown opens its doors
